abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the outcome of the project is
            satisfactory, having corrected major inefficiencies in the
            education sector, and, exceeded most of its original
            targets. However, sustainability seems unlikely, for it
            depends on solving two basic conditions - the ongoing war,
            and macroeconomic imbalances - to allow increased budget
            allocations for the education sector. Lessons drawn form the
            project, re-enforce that basic levels of quality education
            systems will be sustained, as long as Government assures a
            minimum allocation for education expenditures. Nonetheless,
            sound decisions were taken by the Government to create
            motivated teamwork, such as making the Ministry of
            Education's Department of Planning, responsible for the
            implementation of the project, creating a sense of
            ownership, even under stressful circumstances. Furthermore,
            the government negotiated with the teacher's union, a
            policy to attract, and retain qualified educational staff,
            though unfortunately, this policy needs to be enforced, and,
            the role of the National Institute for Educational Research
            and Development, in the production of learning materials,
            needs to be revisited, allowing instead, the efficacy of
            experienced teachers, in adapting foreign learning
            materials. Given the country's weak institutional
            capacity, the two-way demonstration model, targeting quality
            improvement, and accessibility, was reasonable in that
            experience was gained by implementation of the model itself.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objectives are to start
            correcting the major inefficiencies in the education sector
            and prepare a strategy for the overall rehabilitation,
            revitalization and progressive expansion of the education
            system.  The project consists of four components: Setting up
            a demonstration model for education throught improvement of
            the quality of inputs and adaptation of the education
            structure.  This will include the strengthening of the
            National Institute for Educational Research and Development,
            provision of textbooks to Primary Teacher College, and
            rehabilitaion of seven and construction of six primary and
            secondary schools. (b) Strengthening of the Ministry of
            Education's capacity through the training of sector
            administrators and the strengthening of the central and
            provincial institutions' capabilities for planning,
            budgeting, and human material resources management. (c)
            Improvement of the teaching of economics and management of
            the university through training of staff and provision of
            quality inputs to the faculty of economics and rationalizing
            and strenthening the university management information
            system. Finally, (d) studies and preparation of future
            investments to define the financial framework and pace for
            the reform, rehabilitation and expansion of the education
            system, and develop a related investment program.
